sentences: Tomoko Kawase (川瀬 智子, Kawase Tomoko, born February 6, 1975) is a Japanese singer, songwriter, producer, actress, and model from Kyoto.
Two of her songs were used in the 2004 film adaption of Kamikaze Girls.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: From 2001 to 2009, she released music through Defstar Records, a division of Sony Music Japan.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 2010 she was signed to Warner Music Japan.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 2005, an official Blythe doll of Kawase was released.
section: == Biography ==
== Life and career == | === 1995–2001: The Brilliant Green ===

sentences: In 1995, after bassist Shunsaku Okuda and guitarist Ryo Matsui heard her sing in an amateur talent contest, Kawase was asked to join The Brilliant Green as the lead vocalist.
section: == Life and career == | === 1995–2001: The Brilliant Green ===

sentences: Their break came in 1998 when their third single, "There Will Be Love There" was chosen as the theme song for the popular Japanese drama Love Again, and as a result went straight to the top of the charts.
section: == Life and career == | === 1995–2001: The Brilliant Green ===

sentences: After scoring another number one hit with "Tsumetai Hana", they released their self-titled debut album which sold over one million copies in just two days.
section: == Life and career == | === 1995–2001: The Brilliant Green ===

sentences: On the back of this success their first national tour, titled "There Will Be Live There," sold out across Japan in only three minutes.
section: == Life and career == | === 1995–2001: The Brilliant Green ===

sentences: In 2013, Kawase started releasing music from all her personas in commemoration of the Brilliant Green's 15th anniversary.
section: == Life and career == | === 1995–2001: The Brilliant Green ===
== Life and career == | === 2001–2009: Tommy february6 / Tommy heavenly6 - Solo career under DefStar Records ===

sentences: In 2001, Kawase joined DefStar Records and launched her solo career under the character of Tommy february6 (named from a combination of her nickname and birth date) with "Everyday at the Bus Stop".
section: == Life and career == | === 2001–2009: Tommy february6 / Tommy heavenly6 - Solo career under DefStar Records ===

sentences: Vastly different from the pop rock sound of The Brilliant Green, Tommy february6's persona and sound are inspired by and derived from British and American 1980's synthpop, including a cover of Strawberry Switchblade's "Since Yesterday".
section: == Life and career == | === 2001–2009: Tommy february6 / Tommy heavenly6 - Solo career under DefStar Records ===
